channel.title: yudel tweets
channel.description: A feed of recent tweets from yudel.

item.description: @SruliFruchter Yasher koach! What comes next for you?
@NTarnopolsky Not the Nobel Bibi was hoping for, but may have to suffice.
@kampeas Definitely a pain not to be an average American Jew. https://t.co/v3WcozfOeM
Rewatching Dylan’s 83 video is my perfect moment of 80s zen. https://t.co/ThQM3fKzfW
@EladNehorai Heinlein understood. https://t.co/AgjdMRiADh
Big news out of northern New Jersey this weekend, if it can be verified. https://t.co/rStAK2gnHq
@EladNehorai Check out JJ Goldberg’s Substack post.

@MercyFlushes @LesserFrederick @PittCabe The current #RogueSCOTUS doesn’t believe in following precedent. It believes most major court decisions in the past 90 years were wrong and should be overturned.
@onthemainline So the Centre can hold after all.
@LodestoneDavid Even Christians should be free to practice their dietary traditions. I merely ask that my tax dollars don’t subsidize and promote their abominable behavior.
Yet another one-thriving shul falls victim to YIVO-style secularism. I blame @eddyportnoy. https://t.co/DXRRYkpOn2

25/ Frankly, I'd feel better if McCain just forthrightly called for an America that reflected "Christian values." It has the virtue of honesty. And truth has always been a value in the Jewish tradition. https://t.co/NfSSRcYUMO

16/ and as one of a number of capital offenses including adultery and desecrating Shabbat. Why, then, can Klinghoffer claim Judeo-Christian support in getting the government to ban gay marriage while keeping lobster legal?
17/ From a Torah, that is to say Jewish, perspective, a far better case can be made for banning government subsidies to the shellfish industry.
18/ Similarly, Israeli religious bureaucrats have their biblical priorities straight when they try to ensure that no bride gets married when she is having her period. Well, it turns out that although St. Paul thought keeping kosher was passe, he simply didn't like homosexuals.
19/ (See I Corinthians 6:9-10). In other words, is a ban against gay-marriage Christian? Very. Judeo? Not so much. I FOUND something similar with another hot-button "values" issue: abortion.
20/ John McCain said he believes life begins at conception. That's a fair conservative Christian position, but one that runs roughshod over the Talmudic tradition that life doesn't begin until 40 days after conception.
21/ Republicans mocked Sen. Barack Obama for characterizing the question of when life begins as "above my pay grade." But give Obama credit: Unlike McCain, he wasn't denying the Jewish tradition. Of course, Christian intolerance is endemic to Judeo-Christian history.
22/ As Cohen observed: "We can learn learn much from the history of Jewish-Christian relations but the one thing we cannot make of it is a discourse of community, fellowship, and understanding."
23/ KLINGHOFFER, HOWEVER, is so ignorant of that history that he portrays the Crusades as a good thing! Although Klinghoffer describes himself as an Orthodox Jew, he values siding with Christians against liberals and Muslims above honoring the suffering of his own people.
24/ It's enough to make one wonder. Will John McCain and his Christian backers be any more cognizant of a distinct Jewish point of view than is Klinghoffer, conservatism's Jewish apostle?

9/ "We've got to educate and train these people," he said, referring to laid-off workers. "It is a Judeo-Christian values nation and it's an obligation we have and we are not doing it."
10/ Was McCain really treating government-funded retraining programs as sacred ethical imperatives?
11/ Or was he simply pandering to the evangelicals who twice elected George W. Bush president? As McCain told Beliefnet last year, "The number one issue people should make selection of the president of the United States is,
12/ 'Will this person carry on in the Judeo-Christian principled tradition that has made this nation the greatest experiment in the history of mankind?'"
13/ JUST WHAT is this Judeo-Christian tradition? I got an unhealthy dose of the language of Judeo-Christian values when I set out to critique conservative columnist David Klinghoffer's book, How Would God Vote: Why the Bible Commands You to Be a Conservative.
14/ On issue after issue, what Klinghoffer touted as a "Judeo-Christian" ethic was in fact a Christian concern, pure and simple. Take for example an issue on the ballot in several states this November: gay marriage.
15/ As citizens, we have to ask: Is gay marriage really the life-and-death governmental concern opponents portray it to be? As Jews, we consider homosexual sex one of many Biblical "abominations," ranging from eating non-kosher animals to having sex during menstruation,
This, but for Christopher Pike. https://t.co/jT7wqRtHve
@ProjectVirginia Ha! As it happens my arguments about Judaism and this topic are free on Kindle today. https://t.co/hVDA0OpHEe
@AkivaMCohen According to Rashi, that is not a Torah based proposition. אין מוקדם ומאוחר בתורה. So it’s a Religious Liberty infringement to insist on it.
@froomkin Sounds like an editor inserted (or insisted on) those lines. The question is who assigned the story, or accepted the writer’s pitch for it.

I remember in 2008 that my parents had no idea about the ugly divorce story in McCain’s biography. https://t.co/r9G219b5wp
(Pretty sure I snuck that tidbit into my pre-2008 election book, How Would God Really Vote, which is free on Kindle today. https://t.co/sxQwURddbi)
This. https://t.co/uGbgNVeySU
@EladNehorai Note that Dennis Prager and Mark Levin have been auditioning for decades to run the camps for these people.
@EladNehorai The extremists worship an abusive God. And that ultimately why the leaders of the OU and YU sided with the abusers.

@EladNehorai But it’s not even “extremists.” Once you believe in a God who balances all the books, why worry if the society you build crushes people into dust? God will make them good in the end if they deserve it. https://t.co/iSvKYBZ1Vu
@EladNehorai If “death is not the end,” why worry about the children slaughtered by Republican gun proliferation?
@EricJGreenberg1 @SenWhitehouse Please remember that the current #RogueSCOTUS has repeatedly said they are not bound by precedent.
@joshtpm @aravosis Hard to believe someone might be less than honest in a magazine funded by an organization led by Iran-Contra perjurer Elliott Abrams.
